parable.title: The Sower and the Seed
parable.content: A farmer went out to sow seed. As he scattered it, some fell along the path, some on rocky ground, some among thorns, and some on good soil, where it produced a crop.
parable.reflection: Where does the seed of God's word fall in your life?

parable.title: The Mustard Seed
parable.content: The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed, which a man took and planted in his field. Though it is the smallest of all seeds, yet when it grows, it is the largest of garden plants and becomes a tree.
parable.reflection: How has small faith grown into something greater in your life?

parable.title: The Growing Seed
parable.content: This is what the kingdom of God is like. A man scatters seed on the ground. Night and day, whether he sleeps or gets up, the seed sprouts and grows, though he does not know how.
parable.reflection: What seeds have you planted that are growing beyond your understanding?

parable.title: The Vine and Branches
parable.content: I am the vine; you are the branches. If you remain in me and I in you, you will bear much fruit; apart from me you can do nothing.
parable.reflection: How do you stay connected to the source of your growth?

parable.title: The Harvest
parable.content: The harvest is plentiful but the workers are few. Ask the Lord of the harvest, therefore, to send out workers into his harvest field.
parable.reflection: What harvest awaits your faithful work?
